title: How much of a song can I legally sample? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: While there is little doubt about the creative and inspirational value of sampling in modern music production, the short and safe answer here is, “none.” Anything you sample from another artist’s recording, and is recognizable/recognized by any party, puts you at risk for lawsuit. I recommend going the legal route and either licensing the sample properly, or replaying/hiring someone to recreate what you love about the recording, keeping in mind that you still may be subject to copyright terms. Here’s a great article[1] on the subject by Sean McCauley of Octane. My recommendation from experience on both sides is to stay legal and avoid problems down the road. What if you create something now that suddenly and unexpectedly becomes popular 5 years from now, tangling you in legal issues at a time when your song (and your career, touring, studio work, etc.) needs your attention most? Footnotes[1] Music Rights: How To Sample Legally | Octiive

Without permission, none….
